revised_title: No Evidence for Fluctuating Asymmetry as a Reliable Signal in Earwig Forceps
tldr: This study investigates patterns of fluctuating asymmetry in earwig forceps and finds no evidence for it being a reliable signal in sexual selection. The research measures asymmetries in the forceps and elytra of 30 earwig genera and concludes that fluctuating asymmetry values are not greater in the forceps than the elytra, as previously predicted. The overall relation between forceps length and fluctuating asymmetry is flat, suggesting that forceps are not condition-dependent traits.
